text: Hi All! I'm excited to join the group. I'm Content Marketing Manager at Code Climate, and I specialize in creating accessible, engaging content about complex, technical topics. I'm also a filmmaker (I created a comedic web series, and have written and produced multiple short films), and recently co-created a dramatic podcast.

I'm also a filmmaker (I created a comedic web series, and have written and produced multiple short films), and recently co-created a dramatic podcast.

text: As an aside, that (Code Climate) looks like a really interesting offering.  In a past life, I was an IT management consultant that would often help enterprise leadership figure out what was putting them behind schedule, and then lay out a remediation plan.  The data your offering is providing is a lot of the kind of data that I'd have people gather (laboriously) by hand.  Would that this had existed 4 years ago :slightly_smiling_face:

text: :raised_hands:  :handshake:

Hello Folks, I work with a database startup called TerminusDB. We building a data collaboration hub (GitHub for data). I am surrounded by engineers doing amazing work and try to squeeze as much content out as I can. Not a content marketing specialist (more generalist) and keen to learn more. Goals are communicating to a technical community while keeping things friendly. Here is a Nicki Minaj parody we made to give you a flavor of what we're talking about: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yNbc44TGBTc>

I am surrounded by engineers doing amazing work and try to squeeze as much content out as I can. Not a content marketing specialist (more generalist) and keen to learn more. text: This is wonderfully weird

text:
Howdy y'all. Newb here. My name is Marshall, I'm a Creative Lead at Atlassian. We make team collaboration software like Jira and Trello and Confluence. Previously, I was a copywriter, content designer, and creative director at various agencies. Now I spend my days working with engineers, service designers, and UXDs.

I'm also a recovering film producer, a once-and-future podcaster, and a dedicated amateur illustrator. Happy to be here!

elements.text:
